objectives.primary_objective: Students understand what science is and why we observe the world around us.
learning_outcomes: Explain what science means in simple words.
Recognize that asking questions is part of science.
Identify examples of observing and exploring.

word_list.definition: To look carefully at something to learn about it.
word_list.example_usage: We observe the stars at night.

word_list.definition: A sentence we ask to find something out.
word_list.example_usage: Ravi asked a question about the ants.

word_list.definition: To look around and learn new things.
word_list.example_usage: We explore nature to learn how it works.

content_blocks.text: Welcome to Science! Today we will learn what science means and how scientists think.
Ravi saw ants carrying food. He wondered, 'How do they know where to go?' His mother smiled and said, 'That is science — asking questions about what you see.'
Science means observing things carefully and asking questions to understand how they work. Scientists explore the world around them — just like Ravi did!

alternate_expressions: Science is learning by watching and asking why.
Science helps us find answers by observing the world.
When we notice how things happen, that is science.
ai_expression_coach.ai_prompt: Can you say what science means in your own way?

ai_followup_feedback.positive_response: Excellent! That’s another clear way to explain science.
ai_followup_feedback.neutral_response: Good start! Try adding that science means observing or asking questions.
ai_followup_feedback.incorrect_response: Let's rephrase: science means learning by observing and asking questions.

content_blocks.text: Look around your classroom. Name three things you can see, hear, or touch. You just did science!

alternate_expressions: I can see a fan, I can hear my teacher, I can touch my book.
I notice the window, I hear the bell, I feel my chair.
I observe light, sound, and touch around me.
ai_expression_coach.ai_prompt: Try saying your answers in a full sentence. You can use 'I observe' or 'I notice'.

ai_followup_feedback.positive_response: Nice work! That’s how a young scientist speaks.
ai_followup_feedback.neutral_response: That’s right, but try to use 'I observe' or 'I can hear' to describe more clearly.
ai_followup_feedback.incorrect_response: Let's fix it together. Start with 'I can see' or 'I can hear'.

content_blocks.text: Science helps us learn about the world by observing, asking, and exploring. Everyone can be a little scientist every day!

star_rating_system.promotion_rule: Minimum 2 stars required to unlock next lesson.

weaknesses_analysis: Needs to explain ideas with full sentences.

for_two_star_students.growth_feedback: You did well! Try redoing the activity using complete sentences to earn your 3rd star.
example_phrases_for_retry: Science is learning by watching and asking why.
I observe light, sound, and touch around me.

for_three_star_students.mastery_feedback: Fantastic! You’ve mastered expressing what science means and how to observe like a scientist.

badges_system.Concept Master: Understood the core meaning of science.
